> >I'm just trying to find what I hope is the last bug in a program (Log
file
> >converter, finally got the major bugs out but of 8000 records only 6500
> >converted right...) and once I finish it I can work on the scenario
editor
> >task you gave us :)
>
> Don't tell me you're making a mircstats clone TOO... (that's the othe
thing i'm working on, coding-wise.. nothing fancy, just the basic "when do
we talk here" and "who said how many lines" functions will do, for now.
Linking nicks is *PAINFUL*)


Hehe, no actually it converts web site log files (CLF format).  I finally
moved my domain a couple of months ago to a much better host but the only
problem was while it produced more info (mainly referrer info) in the log
files, they were not in the 'standard' format, and so the analyser
(webalizer) I use couldn't process them.
So I just wrote a program to take the input file, convert each line and
produce an output file.
Since I'd never done much file I/O before it was quite a learning
experience, but it does work now, and I now have this big pile of info for
my website to improve it :)

> >Oh, how are the other programmers going with the editor task?
>
> Got the header information to load correctly, and added some testing
functions to ensure that the grid file you load *IS* a gridfile, and that
gridfile is a v7 or v8 gridfile... (tho i think i might be able to figure
out the differences of earlier versions too)
>
> Right now, almost everything is in main() with limited useage of
functions... mainly because I was coding off the top of my head for most of
the header. It'll all be separated out into proper functions eventually.
haven't touched it in a week.. and then i go away on vacation on the 3rd..
so it'll probably have to wait until the 11th, when i return. i'll have some
net access but no compiler access during that time.
>
> linked list for the objects looks to be the easiest way to handle them,
just FYI.. though on some of those maps, there's like a billion objects! :/

Hehe, yeah I hadn't thought much about data structures, but a linked list
sounds the best (or maybe a queue, though a queue wouldn't be any good for
the full editor, just for conversion).

Also DPH - the objects on top of each other won't matter, as each individual
one has it's own X,Y location, so we just read it, store it, and write it
out again, as long as we put the objects back in the same order we took them
out the game should load the file the same :)

Well I'm off to work on it, once I get something usable going I'll put it on
my website for people to play with.

Cya's,
Deathifier
